conclusion: Consider the critical angle for total internal reflection.
Identify the critical angle as the angle of incidence above which total internal reflection occurs.
Critical angle is given by sin(theta_c) = 1/N.
The optical fiber is bent into a semicircle with a turning radius r.
The diameter of the optical fiber is D, so the radius of the fiber is D/2.
For total internal reflection, the angle of incidence at the outer edge must be at least the critical angle.
The angle of incidence at the outer edge is related to the radius of curvature r and the radius of the fiber D/2.
Relate sin(theta_c) = D/(2r) and substitute sin(theta_c) = 1/N.
Solve for r to get r = ND/2.
The turning radius r should be not less than ND/2 to ensure total internal reflection.
